data.title: 30 Best Keith David Quotes With Image
data.meta_description: 1.Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.2.The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
data.text:
Keith David | Introduction

Keith David Williams, known professionally as Keith David, is an American actor, voice actor, and singer. With a distinctive deep voice and commanding presence, David has established himself as one of the most versatile and accomplished performers in the entertainment industry. Born on June 4, 1956, in Harlem, New York City, David developed a passion for acting at an early age. He attended the Manhattan High School of Performing Arts and later went on to study at the prestigious Juilliard School, where he honed his craft and refined his skills. David made his debut on Broadway in 1979, portraying Childs in the critically acclaimed production of "The Lady from Dubuque." This marked the beginning of his illustrious stage career, during which he went on to appear in numerous plays, including "Macbeth," "The White Devil," and "The Shadow Box." His remarkable performances on stage earned him recognition and respect within the theater community. In addition to his stage work, David began to make a name for himself on the silver screen. He made his film debut in 1982 with a small role in "The Thing," but it was his portrayal of the smooth-talking gangster Quick in the cult classic "The Warriors" (1979) that garnered him widespread attention. From there, David went on to deliver memorable performances in films such as "Platoon" (1986), "They Live" (1988), and "Dead Presidents" (1995). However, it is David's work in the realm of voice acting that has truly set him apart. His deep and resonant voice has become a staple in the industry, and he has lent his talents to a wide array of animated films, television shows, and video games. Notable voice roles include Goliath in the animated series "Gargoyles," Dr. Facilier in Disney's "The Princess and the Frog," and the Arbiter in the popular video game franchise "Halo." David's versatility as an actor is further demonstrated by his work in television. He has appeared in various television shows, showcasing his range and ability to embody a diverse range of characters. Notable television credits include roles in "ER," "Community," and "Greenleaf," for which he received critical acclaim. Beyond his on-screen and voice acting accomplishments, David is also an accomplished singer. He has performed in several stage musicals, including "Jelly's Last Jam," for which he received a Tony Award nomination. His rich baritone voice has also been featured in recordings and live performances, further showcasing his immense talent. Throughout his career, Keith David has garnered numerous accolades for his work, including multiple Emmy Award nominations and a NAACP Image Award. He has become a respected figure in the entertainment industry, known for his professionalism, dedication, and immense talent. In addition to his successful acting career, David is also an advocate for various social causes, including civil rights, the arts, and education. He actively uses his platform to raise awareness and make a positive impact in the world. Overall, Keith David is a man of many talents and accomplishments. His exceptional acting skills, powerful voice, and passion for his craft have cemented his status as a true icon in the entertainment industry. With an extensive body of work spanning across theater, film, television, and voice acting, David continues to captivate audiences with his exceptional performances and unwavering dedication to his craft.

5 Facts About Keith David

1. Keith David is an accomplished voice actor and has lent his voice to numerous video games and animated series. Some of his notable voice roles include the character of Goliath in the animated series "Gargoyles" and Detective Bullock in "The Batman."

2. In addition to his voice-over work, David has had a successful acting career in film and television. He has appeared in over 150 movies and TV shows, including memorable roles in films like "Platoon," "The Thing," and "They Live."

3. Keith David is an accomplished stage actor and has performed in various theater productions. He has received critical acclaim and earned several awards for his performances, including a Tony nomination for his role in the play "Jelly's Last Jam."

4. Despite his extensive on-screen and voice-over work, Keith David is known to maintain a relatively private life. He prefers to keep his personal life out of the public eye and rarely discusses it in interviews or on social media.

5. One surprising fact about Keith David is his deep and resonant voice, which has become his trademark. He has often been sought after to provide voice-overs for documentaries, commercials, and narrations due to the captivating and authoritative quality of his voice.
